title: Golfweek Teams Up with International Association of Golf Administrators (IAGA)
text:
Golfweek and the International Association of Golf Administrators (IAGA) have announced a new partnership to further strengthen and elevate the status of amateur golf in North America. The relationship will help to connect more than 2 million amateur golfers with the resources and reach of the USA TODAY NETWORK and USA TODAY Sports Media Group.

In cooperation with the IAGA and its 700+ golf administrator members, Golfweek will have the opportunity to partner directly with state and regional golf associations to write compelling content for Golfweek.com and its magazine, distribute email newsletters, offer digital and print subscriptions and create opportunities to grow membership. At a national level, Golfweek and the IAGA will work together to share learnings, develop more effective growth strategies and create new events for member organizations.

“We are truly excited to work with the IAGA and its members to help better meet their goals,” said Patrick Leahy, Associate Publisher of Golfweek and Vice President of Revenue for USA TODAY Golf. “By providing customized content for individual Associations and unique benefits that appeal to serious golfers, we will bring the full power of our Golfweek/USA TODAY Golf Platform to tens of thousands of golfers across the country. We also will offer brands the opportunity to reach this audience with tremendous scale and effectiveness.”

“The IAGA is thrilled to partner with a golf industry media leader such as Golfweek,” said IAGA Executive Director, Bill Walker. “Our 80 plus member associations continually strive to provide enhanced benefits to retain and engage members and this partnership will assist in accomplishing these objectives.”
